cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.EC. 

The paper deals with the problem of revenue maximization in mechanism design, which is a central topic in algorithmic game theory and economics. The paper uses techniques from information theory, statistical learning theory, and computational complexity theory to derive upper and lower bounds on the sample complexity of single-parameter revenue maximization. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory), which is the intersection of computer science and economics. Other likely sub-categories include cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.EC (Economics and Computation).
